universum.studios.android.ui.widget

Class EditTextWidget

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.widget.TextView
        • android.widget.EditText
          • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.EditTextWidget
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable.Callback, AccessibilityEventSource, KeyEvent.Callback, ViewTreeObserver.OnPreDrawListener, universum.studios.android.font.FontWidget, ErrorWidget, Widget

    public class EditTextWidget
extends EditText
implements Widget, universum.studios.android.font.FontWidget, ErrorWidget
    Extended version of EditText. This updated EditText allows setting of custom font (from assets) and tinting for the Android versions below LOLLIPOP and other useful features described below.

    Tinting

    Tinting is supported via Xml attributes listed below:
    • uiBackgroundTint
    • uiBackgroundTintMode

    Note, that on LOLLIPOP and above SDK versions can be also used Xml attributes listed above where in such case will be used the native tinting.

    This widget also overrides all SDK methods used to tint its components like setBackgroundTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList) or setBackgroundTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode), so these can be used regardless the current version of SDK but invoking of these methods below LOLLIPOP can be done only directly upon instance of this widget otherwise NoSuchMethodException will be thrown.

    Custom font

    Custom font (the path to it) can be specified basically at 4 places from where it can be by this font widget referenced. Note, that your custom font must be placed within Android assets folder within sub-folder named "font", this is requirement of this library, within this sub-folder you can specify your custom hierarchy to organize your fonts. 

          1) Declare path to custom font in an Application theme:
      <style name="Theme" parent="android:Theme.Material">
          <item name="uiFontPath">roboto/roboto_light.ttf</item>
      </style>
      - This font will be than applied to all widgets from this library.

      --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

      2) Declare path to custom font in a global TextAppearance style:
      <style name="TextAppearance.Widget" parent="android:TextAppearance.Material.Widget">
          <item name="uiFontPath">roboto/roboto_light.ttf</item>
      </style>
      - This font will be than applied only to widgets from this library that has this text
        appearance as theirs style or just reference to this text appearance within theirs style.

      --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

      3) Declare path to custom font in a specific widget's style:
      <style name="Widget.EditText" parent="android:Widget.Material.EditText">
          <item name="uiFontPath">roboto/roboto_light.ttf</item>
      </style>
      - This font will be than applied only to widgets (EditTexts) from this library
        that has this style as theirs style set through theme global attribute
        (like <item name="android:editTextStyle">@style/Widget.EditText</item>)
        or set within Xml layout (like style="@style/Widget.EditText").

      --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

      4) Declare path to custom font in an Xml layout:
      <LinearLayout
          xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
          xmlns:ui="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
          android:layout_width="match_parent"
          android:layout_height="match_parent"
          android:orientation="vertical">

          // ... Some views

          <universum.studios.android.ui.widget.EditTextWidget
              android:layout_width="wrap_content"
              android:layout_height="wrap_content"
              android:text="Text view with custom font."
              ui:uiFontPath="roboto/roboto_light">

          // ... Some other views

      </LinearLayout>
      - This font will be than applied only to that particular widget.

    Note, that it is not necessary to specify also '.ttf' suffix for custom font paths, the library will add one if it is missing.

    XML attributes

    See EditText, EditTextWidget Attributes

    Default style attribute

    android:editTextStyle
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky
    See Also:
    TextViewWidget, AutoCompleteTextViewWidget

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EditTextWidget(Context context)
      Same as EditTextWidget(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet) without attributes.
      EditTextWidget(Context context, AttributeSet attrs)
      Same as EditTextWidget(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet, int) with R.attr.editTextStyle as attribute for default style.
      EditTextWidget(Context context, AttributeSet attrs, int defStyleAttr)
      Same as EditTextWidget(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet, int, int) with 0 as default style.
      EditTextWidget(Context context, AttributeSet attrs, int defStyleAttr, int defStyleRes)
      Creates a new instance of EditTextWidget for the given context.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      WidgetSizeAnimator animateSize()
      Not supported yet.
      void clearError()
      Clears the current error of this widget (if any).
      Drawable getBackground()
      Note, that on pre LOLLIPOP Android versions this method will return an instance of TintDrawable if tint has been applied via setBackgroundTintList(ColorStateList).
      ColorStateList getBackgroundTintList() 
      PorterDuff.Mode getBackgroundTintMode() 
      Drawable[] getCompoundDrawables()
      Note, that on pre LOLLIPOP Android versions this method will return array containing instances of TintDrawable (if any) if compound drawable tint has been applied via setCompoundDrawableTintList(ColorStateList).
      Drawable[] getCompoundDrawablesRelative()
      Note, that on pre LOLLIPOP Android versions this method will return array containing instances of TintDrawable (if any) if compound drawable tint has been applied via setCompoundDrawableTintList(ColorStateList).
      ColorStateList getCompoundDrawableTintList() 
      PorterDuff.Mode getCompoundDrawableTintMode()

      Returns the error specified for this widget (if any).

      Checks whether this widget has error specified or not.

      void setCompoundVectorDrawablesRelativeWithIntrinsicBounds(int startResId, int topResId, int endResId, int bottomResId)
      Like TextView.setCompoundDrawablesRelativeWithIntrinsicBounds(int, int, int, int) but this method will use ResourceUtils.getVectorDrawable(Resources, int, Resources.Theme) utility method to obtain the desired vector drawables and set them as compound Drawables via TextView.setCompoundDrawablesWithIntrinsicBounds(Drawable, Drawable, Drawable, Drawable) method.

                      @AttrRes
                      int defStyleAttr)
        Same as EditTextWidget(android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet, int, int) with 0 as default style.

      • EditTextWidget

        public EditTextWidget(@NonNull
                      Context context,
                      @Nullable
                      AttributeSet attrs,
                      @AttrRes
                      int defStyleAttr,
                      @StyleRes
                      int defStyleRes)
        Creates a new instance of EditTextWidget for the given context.
        Parameters:
        context - Context in which will be the new view presented.
        attrs - Set of Xml attributes used to configure the new instance of this view.
        defStyleAttr - An attribute which contains a reference to a default style resource for this view within a theme of the given context.
        defStyleRes - Resource id of the default style for the new view.

      • setError

        public void setError(@NonNull
                     CharSequence error)
        Description copied from interface: ErrorWidget
        Sets an error for this widget. To clear the specified error, call ErrorWidget.clearError().

        Note, that presentation of the given error to a user depends on a specific implementation of this error widget. Some implementations may not event display this error, but each widget should at least create its Drawable state in View.onCreateDrawableState(int) with ui_state_error as extra state.

        Specified by:
        setError in interface ErrorWidget
        Overrides:
        setError in class TextView
        Parameters:
        error - The desired error to be presented by this widget to the user.
        See Also:
        ErrorWidget.getError(), ErrorWidget.hasError(), ErrorWidget.clearError()

        Specified by:

        Returns:

        Overrides:
        setCompoundDrawables in class TextView

      • getCompoundDrawables

        @NonNull
public Drawable[] getCompoundDrawables()
        Note, that on pre LOLLIPOP Android versions this method will return array containing instances of TintDrawable (if any) if compound drawable tint has been applied via setCompoundDrawableTintList(ColorStateList).

        The original wrapped drawables can be obtained via DrawableWrapper.getDrawable().

        Overrides:
        getCompoundDrawables in class TextView

      • setCompoundVectorDrawablesRelativeWithIntrinsicBounds

        public void setCompoundVectorDrawablesRelativeWithIntrinsicBounds(@DrawableRes
                                                                  int startResId,
                                                                  @DrawableRes
                                                                  int topResId,
                                                                  @DrawableRes
                                                                  int endResId,
                                                                  @DrawableRes
                                                                  int bottomResId)
        Like TextView.setCompoundDrawablesRelativeWithIntrinsicBounds(int, int, int, int) but this method will use ResourceUtils.getVectorDrawable(Resources, int, Resources.Theme) utility method to obtain the desired vector drawables and set them as compound Drawables via TextView.setCompoundDrawablesWithIntrinsicBounds(Drawable, Drawable, Drawable, Drawable) method.

        Note, that this method will fall back to TextView.setCompoundDrawablesWithIntrinsicBounds(Drawable, Drawable, Drawable, Drawable) method on an Android API level that does not support relative compound drawables.

        Parameters:
        startResId - Resource id of the desired compound vector drawable to be shown at the start of the text. Can be 0 to clear the current one.
        topResId - Resource id of the desired compound vector drawable to be shown at the top of the text. Can be 0 to clear the current one.
        endResId - Resource id of the desired compound vector drawable to be shown at the end of the text. Can be 0 to clear the current one.
        bottomResId - Resource id of the desired compound vector drawable to be shown at the bottom of the text. Can be 0 to clear the current one.
